1.增進學生對當代西方思潮的理解
2.提供學生思考跨領域合作的可能性
goal.en:
1.To enhance students’ grasp of contemporary western thoughts.
2.Provide students with the possibility of thinking about cross-field cooperation

outline.ch:
一般而言，所謂「當代」意指二十世紀迄今。但是當代西方思潮，卻很難僅以時間作為思想的分期。
如果說，西方近代哲學起於笛卡爾確立了主體哲學的基礎；現代思潮則以黑格爾之後，作為起點；那麼當代的開始，或許可以從分別代表歐陸哲學的海德格以及英美分析哲學的維根斯坦，同時以「哲學終結」為結論的主張作為開端。
由於當代西方思潮多元且豐富，彼此雖不一定有直接的繼承關係，但卻可能因為相互影響，而開出另一個學派。換言之，以地域性來區分當代哲學，也不是最恰當的分類方式。
一個學期的課程中，無法盡數介紹所有當代西方思潮。因之，僅介紹其中幾項具代表性的思潮，以作為認識的開始。另一方面，當代社會、政治、藝術、文化，甚至科學等，也都少不了哲學作為基礎，因此越理解當代西方思想，就越能進行跨領域的合作與嘗試。

outline.en:
Generally speaking, “contemporary“ refers to the twentieth century to the present. However, in contemporary Western thought, it is difficult to use time alone as a periodization of thought.
If we say that modern Western philosophy began with Descartes, who established the foundation of subject philosophy; modern philosophical trends started after Hegel; then the contemporary era may begin with the perspectives of Heidegger and of Wittgenstein respectively representing European philosophy and analytic philosophy. Both of them took the “end of philosophy“ as their conclusion, which happens to be what we think of as the beginning of contemporary philosophy.
Due to the diversity and richness of contemporary Western thoughts, although they may not necessarily have a direct inheritance relationship with each other, they may influence each other and lead to the creation of another school of thought. In other words, it is not the most appropriate way to classify contemporary philosophy based on regional characteristics.
It is impossible to introduce all contemporary Western thoughts in a one-semester course. Therefore, I only introduce a few representative trends of thought as a starting point for understanding. On the other hand, contemporary society, politics, art, culture, and even science are all based on philosophy. Therefore, the more students understand contemporary Western thought, the more they can conduct cross-field cooperation and attempts.Week 1
